answers.answer: Hi JjK.. I'm going to repost a post I posted on the pain Management forum. Originally ActingBrandNew posted it here. It seems to me you could check the ingredients against the list. If it is there at least you will have Something to show your po I hope it all works out. lesa

Great information from Lesa!Assuming your PO did a "urine" test rather than a "blood" test, right?  Because there are so many over the counter medications that can affect a urine test, it would be good to request a blood test if your PO will agree to that.  It would be the easiest way to clear this up for you.  Good luck~

question: Could it be the Tylenol PM I take
title: never taken methadone in my life and I tested positive for it today at po office.
